critique: This executive order amends a previous order regarding the President's Council on Youth Opportunity. It primarily concerns the composition of the council, specifying its members and chairmanship. There's no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, or stances on national security vs. civil liberties. The order doesn't seem to significantly expand executive power, as it mainly modifies the structure of an existing council. It doesn't directly address federalism, economic regulation, or social inclusion in a substantive way. Therefore, the initial scores are mostly neutral.
